item.title: Mentioned by Collingwood Enterprise Bulletin
item.description:
Hospice breaks ground on facility
Simcoe-Grey MP Dr. Kellie Leitch tosses a piece of sod during a groundbreaking ceremony for a permanent facility for Hospice Georgian Triangle, Saturday, Aug. 10, 2013. Morgan Ian Adams/Collingwood Enterprise-Bulletin. Tweet · Bookmark and Share.

item.title: Mentioned by CMAJ
item.description:
A chat with cabinet minister Dr. Kellie Leitch
Now 43-year-old pediatric orthopedic surgeon Dr. Kellie Leitch has another title, though it doesn't start with "M": cabinet minister. In his recent cabinet shuffle, Prime Minister Stephen Harper appointed Leitch, who was elected as the member of parliament for ...

item.title: Mentioned by Fort McMurray Today
item.description:
From Beacon Hill to Parliament Hill
Kellie Leitch's successes can be measured on a national scale. At the age of 42, the Member of Parliament for Simcoe-Grey has been the chair of pediatric surgery at the Children's Hospital of Western Ontario, headed the health stream at Western University's ...

item.description:
Statement from Kellie Leitch
Simcoe Grey MP Kellie Leitch issues statement about being named to cabinet. (Simcoe Grey ) -. The Honourable Dr. Kellie Leitch, Member of Parliament for Simcoe–Grey, made the following statement regarding yesterday's Cabinet shuffle. “I am very happy ...

item.title: Mentioned by Bayshore Broadcasting News Centre
item.description:
Simcoe-Grey MP talks about "Enemies List" and "Talking Points"
Doctor Kellie Leitch was given the Labour and Status of Women portfolios in the federal cabinet shuffle this week. Leitch says the labour portfolio is about safety and fairness for workers, but she also says it's about safety for guest workers as much as citizens.
